title: Shared Situational Awareness
content: Team SA means everyone has the same mental picture of what's happening. Gaps in shared SA cause coordination failures, conflicting actions, and missed information. Don't assume everyone sees what you see. Verbalize your SA. Ask teammates for theirs. Shared SA must be actively built and maintained through communication.

mcq.question: Two operators are working together. Operator A notices a developing problem. Operator B is unaware. What's the issue?

options.B: Shared SA hasn't been establishedâ€”Operator A's perception wasn't communicated
options.C: Only one person needs to track the situation
options.D: Operator A should handle it independently

mcq.explanation: Shared SA requires active communication. Operator A perceived something but didn't share it. The team's SA is only as good as what's communicated, not just what individuals notice.

openQuestions: How does your team build shared SA during operations?
When has a gap in shared SA caused problems for your team?
